description: Pineapple guava (Acca sellowiana) is an amazing plant species. It is grown in a variety of climates, making it a versatile plant to have in any garden. The leaves are medium green with silver highlights, creating a stunning variegated effect. During the summer, white flowers blossom and produce incredibly fragrant fruit that has a unique combination of pineapple and guava flavors. This is an easy-to-grow, low-maintenance bush that will tolerate light frost, making it an ideal species for novice gardeners. Best of all, it is drought tolerant, attracts birds and its beautiful fruit can be enjoyed fresh from the tree.
